utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, you’re not going to believe this. I made up a joke and sent it in to Playboy. They printed it!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I didn’t know Playboy prints jokes.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, they print jokes, interviews, hard-hitting journalism. It’s not just about the pictures.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That didn’t work on mom, it’s not going to work on us.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Here, check it out. It’s the first one, too.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That is funny. It was also funny when I made it up.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I made that joke up.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, oh-oh, no you didn’t. I did.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, I did. I told it to Dan at work, and he said it was the funniest joke he’d ever heard.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, tell Dan, ‘Thanks.’

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I was just reading the joke below it. Man, that one is funny.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Monica, you remember me telling you that joke, right?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, you tell a lot of jokes!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, Chandler, it’s my joke. But, hey, if it makes you feel any better they don’t print the name, so it doesn’t really matter who gets credit, right?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I guess.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey guys.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, Joey, Playboy printed my joke.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, it’s my joke, it’s mine. You can call them, they’ll tell you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It’s my joke.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s my joke.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa-whoa. Jokes? You guys know they have naked chicks in there, right?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Dude, you have got to turn on Behind the Music. The band Heart is having a really tough time, and I think they may break up.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Let’s go watch it at your place.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Nah, Monica’s watching some cooking show. Come on, I don’t want to miss when they were skinny.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Chandler, Chandler, y’know what we should do? You and I should go out and get some new sunglasses.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What? No, I want to watch this. . Did your cable go out?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, that’s VH-1. I gotta tell you, the music these kids listen to today . . . It’s like a lotta noise to me. I don’t know…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Joey, why is your cable out?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I uh, oh! Because, uh, I haven’t really paid the bill

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: If you need money, will you please-please just let me loan you some money?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, Chandler. Look, forget about it, okay? Look, I know things have been a little tight since Janine moved out. Oh, was she hot.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Whoa ho.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know! Yeah, but, look I can handle it. All right? Look, I can listen to the radio, huh? And Ross gave me this great book .

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, you want to see if the joke stealer will let us watch the show at his place?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Paid your phone bill?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Not so much.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s only you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wh-wh-what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: We are looking at a Playboy.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I want to look too! . Yikes!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So do you think that these pictures—Are, are they trying to tell a story?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, sure. I mean, like in the case of this young woman, she has lost her clothes, so she rides naked on the horse, she’s crying out, ‘Where are they, where are they?’

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, she’s not going to find them lying in the grass like that.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Aw, remember the days when you used to go out to the barn, lift up your shirt, and bend over?

utterance.speaker: Rachel and Monica
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You see, now, I would date this girl. She’s cute, she’s outdoorsy, you know, and she knows how to build a fire. I mean, that’s got to come in handy

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, I’ve got a question. If you had to pick one of us to date, who would it be?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Me neither.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don’t know. Me neither.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You forget how many great songs Heart had.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You know, Barracuda was the first song I learned to play on the keyboard.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So, you heard it, you repeated it, so that must mean you wrote it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, you guys, with this joke. I gotta say, I know I cracked up, but I’m not even sure I got it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What, you didn’t get it? The doctor is a monkey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And monkeys can’t write out prescriptions.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You are not allowed to laugh at my joke.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Your joke? Well, I think ‘the Hef’ would disagree, which is why he sent me a check for one hundred ah-dollars.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So, you stole my joke, and you stole my money.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I was going to stick it in the ATM, but now I think I’ll show the sexy teller that I am a published writer.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, she is going to know that you stole the joke.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, what are you going to do, follow me down there?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I’m not going to go now anyway .

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay .

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ah, Gunther, I can’t pay for this right now because I’m not working, so I’ve had to cut down on some luxuries like uh, payin’ for stuff.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Well, if you want, you can work here.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, I don’t know. Ya see, it’s just, see I was a regular on a soap opera y’know? And to go from that to this, I just… Plus, I’d have to wait on all my friends.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Okay, but the money’s good, plus you get to stare at Rachel as much as you want.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Flexible hours.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Maybe I could be a waiter. Could I use the phone?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: She picked Rachel. I mean, she tried to back out of it, but it was obvious. She picked Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: He took my joke, he took it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s wrong. You know what else is wrong? Phoebe picking Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You know who else picked Rachel? Ross, and you know what else Ross did? He stole my joke. You know what? I’m going to get a joke journal. Y’know? And document the date and time of every single one of my jokes.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s a good idea.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Do you know what’s a bad idea?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Picking Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s right. Did you hear something?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Maybe it’s the sound of Ross climbing into my brain and stealing my thoughts.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s coming from the living room.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I finished my book.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, you guys.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, don’t you guys look cute. You guys make such a cute couple.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Monica, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nothing, I’m just trying to recreate some of the fun that we had at my place the other day. Remember, when you picked Rachel over me? That was funny.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I guess it was kinda funny.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It wasn’t funny at all! Why would you do that? Why didn’t you pick me?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Fine. The reason that I was leaning a little bit more toward Rachel than you is just that you’re … just … kinda high maintenance—Okay let’s go to lunch!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That is completely untrue. You think I’m high maintenance? Okay, prove it. I want you to make a list and we’re going to go through it point by point!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, okay, you’re right. You’re easy-going. You’re just not as easy-going as Rachel. She’s just more flexible and-and mellow. That’s all.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, people are different.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ya, you know, Rachel … she’ll do whatever you want. Y’know, you can just walk all over her.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? Wait a minute. What are you saying, that I’m a pushover? I’m not a pushover.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, okay, you’re not a pushover.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my … you think I’m a pushover. Well wait, watch this, you know what? You’re not invited to lunch. What do you think of that? I think that’s pretty strong, that’s what I think. Come on, Monica, let’s go to lunch.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You start working on that list.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I cannot believe her.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know. Where do you wanna go eat?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, oh, I love that Japanese place.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m sick of Japanese. We’re not going there.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, wherever you wanna go is cool.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, hey, Gunther, check this out.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Yeah, that-that Chandler cracks me up.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Ross, listen, you want anything to drink, ‘cause I’m heading up there.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, I’ll take a coffee. Thanks, man.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sure. Coffee? ‘Cause I’m going up there.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You guys need anything, ‘cause I’m heading up there.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: I’d love an ice water.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Just being friendly.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, honey, I don’t think you’re supposed to go back there.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nah, it’s okay. Right, Gunther?

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Don’t wink at me. And put on your apron.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, but I don’t see you asking any other paying customers to put on aprons.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey, do you work here?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Customer
utterance.content: Hey, waiter.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey, what’s going on. What didn’t you tell us you work here?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It’s kind of embarrassing, y’know. I mean, I was an actor and now I’m a waiter. It’s supposed to go in the other direction.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So is your apron. You’re wearing it like a cape.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I mean, the job’s easy and the money’s good, you know? I guess I’m going to be hanging out here anyway. I might as well get paid for it, right? I just feel kind of weird serving you guys.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Come on, Joey, I did it and it was fine.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, why would it be weird? Hey, Joey, can I get some coffee?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, I guess it doesn’t seem that weird.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Seriously, I-I asked you before and you still haven’t gotten it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: See, now it’s weird again.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I think it’s great that you work here. You’re going to make a lot of money, and here’s your first tip: Don’t eat yellow snow. . Ah ha ha, 2:15, coffeehouse.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, you know what? This is great. Finally, I have someone I can pass on my wisdom too. Let me tell you about a couple of things I learned while working at the coffeehouse. First of all, the customer is always right. A smile goes a long way. And if anyone is ever rude to you? Sneeze muffin.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thanks, Rach. Look, you guys are just terrific. Y’know? Now, how about clearing out of here so I can get some new customers. It’s all about turnover.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Joey, seriously, can I get my coffee?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry, Ross. I’ll get it for you right now. And since I made you wait, I’ll toss in a free muffin.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Phoebe. We would like to talk to you for a second.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So, maybe I am a little high maintenance. And maybe Rachel is a little bit of a pushover. But you know what we decided you are?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes, we are very sorry to tell you this, but you, Phoebe, are flaky.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hah!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That true, I am flaky.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So, what, you’re just, you’re just okay with being flaky?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, totally.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, then, I’m okay with being high maintenance.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, and I am okay with being a pushover.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That’s great. Good for you guys.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I am not high maintenance!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I am not a pushover!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Who said you were?

utterance.speaker: Monica and Rachel
utterance.content: You did!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I’m flaky. I’ll say anything.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, Gunther. Can you uh, can you cover for me? I just got an audition.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: No, I’m leaving to get my hair dyed.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Really?! I like your natural color. Come on man, it’s a great part. Look, check it out. I’m the lead guy’s best friend and I wait for him in this bar and save his seat. Listen-listen. ‘I’m sorry, that seat’s saved.’

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: That’s the whole part?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, maybe he’s not his best friend, but …

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll see you in an hour.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, man, I could totally get that part. ‘I’m sorry, that seat is taken.’

utterance.speaker: Patron
utterance.content: Oh, excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, no, I didn’t mean you. But, you believed me, huh?

utterance.speaker: Patron
utterance.content: I believed you were saving this seat for someone.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So, you’d hire me, right?

utterance.speaker: Patron
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Exactly! All right, everybody, listen up. The coffeehouse is going to be closed for about an hour.

utterance.speaker: Customers
utterance.content: Huh? What?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s for the kids. To keep the kids off drugs. It’s a very important issue in this month’s Playboy. I’m sure you all read about it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s my joke.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It’s my joke.

utterance.speaker: Ross and Chandler
utterance.content: It’s my joke.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know, I don’t think we’re going to settle this.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Let’s have Monica decide.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey Mon.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Mon, get out here!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Monica!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, okay. You have to help us decide whose joke this is.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why do I have to decide?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Because you’re the only one that can be fair.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can’t be fair. You’re my boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, but I’m your brother. We’re family. That’s the most important thing in the world.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Don’t try to sway her. I’m your only chance to have a baby. Okay, let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We’ll each tell you how we came up with the joke and then you decide which one of us is telling the truth—me.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, Chandler, you go first.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, I thought of the joke two months ago at lunch with Steve.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, wait, is he the guy I met at Christmas?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Can I finish my story?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Do you want me to pick you?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: See, I would never snap at you like that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Continue.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So Steve said he had to go to the doctor. And Steve’s doctor’s name is Doctor Muppy. So I said, ‘Doctor Monkey?’ And that is how the whole Doctor Monkey thing came up.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Are you kidding? Okay, look. I-I studied evolution. Remember, evolution? Monkey into man? Plus, I’m a doctor, and I had a monkey. I’m Doctor Monkey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m not arguing with that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, I’ve heard enough. I’ve made my decision.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You are both idiots. The joke is not funny, and it’s offensive to women, and doctors, and monkeys! You shouldn’t be arguing over who gets credit, you should be arguing over who gets blamed for inflicting this horrible joke upon the world! Now let it go! The joke sucks!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s your joke.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Is not.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi, Chandler. There you are.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi, oh hi.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, it’s Phoebe and Rachel. Um, why don’t you tell them what you were telling me earlier about me not being high maintenance?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Monica is a self-sufficient, together lady. Being with her has been like being on a vacation. And what may be perceived as high maintenance is merely attention to detail and——generosity of spirit.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow, you know what? That is the best fake speech I think I’ve ever heard.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Really? I’ve heard better.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait, wait, he came up with that himself. Tell them, Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m out of words. Should I just say the whole thing again?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Look, I am not high maintenance. I am not. Chandler!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You’re a little high maintenance.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ahhh! You are on my list.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m sorry. You’re not easy-going, but you’re passionate, and that’s good. And when you get upset about the little things, I think that I’m pretty good about making you feel better about that. And that’s good too. So, they can say that you’re high maintenance, but it’s okay, because I like … maintaining you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I didn’t even tell him to say that. . All right you’re off my list.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m off the list.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe, it’s okay that you don’t want me to be your girlfriend because I have the best boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Y’know, suddenly I find you very attractive.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, buddy boy, how’d the audition go?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Not good, no. I didn’t get the part, and I lost my job here, so …

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! That is a bad audition.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: How-how did you lose your job here?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, I had the audition but Gunther said I had to stay here and be in charge so he could go get his hair dyed. So, I went anyway, and then he fired me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: He left work in the middle of the day to do a personal errand and left you in charge when you’ve been working here two days? That’s not, that’s not right.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, what are ya gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, you can’t let him get away with that. Ya know what, I’m not going to let him get away with that. I’m going to say something to him—No, I really shouldn’t say anything—No, I should say something to him. Gunther, I want you to give Joey his job back. That is really not fair that you have to fire him…

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: He can have his job back.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That’s right, he can have his job back. I’m glad we got that all straightened out. There you go, Joey, you got your job back.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s great. Thanks Rach.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, pretty nice, huh? Now who’s a pushover?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Rach, you’re in my seat.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, I never got to hear who you guys would pick to be your girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I pick you, Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Definitely you, Pheebs.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I kinda thought.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey. Oh, I have a question. If-if-if one of you had to pick one of the other two guys to go out with, who would you pick?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No way.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m not answering that.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Joey! No way. I’m not answering that.
